column4: ok this is going to sound crazy but I setup my entire family with ubuntu the last few days. Laptops freaking desktops media server etc etc 9 total new users now on linux :p I only have 1 complaint so far and I'm going to find a way to duplicate it.
My mom is complaining lol that the only thing she can't do on ubuntu so far that she could on vistacrapola is double click a browser to do a double side by side browser comparison?
To be honest I don't even know what she's talking about but I'm 99% sure somewhere out there ubuntu can do it lol
were you using firefox on vista??
yes sir she was using ff on vista is that a ff option she is talking about?
for one thing..old people who use vista and only know windows....can easily get confused to linux..its just fact
firefox is pretty much the same as windows version..some slight difference..it just runs better
yea that's true but I've been teaching them for 2 days now and they really love ubuntu and are taking to it well. My fam only uses IM's and browsers.
ok I'll try that I been having them all use google chrome beta for linux but I'll switch her back to ff
well there are a ton of browsers available. Opera, Chrome, Firefox, SeaMonkey, etc etc
even konqueror from KDE is pretty simple to understand

well she explained it as - (and I wiped it so its gone now) as a double click in the bottom center of the screen and it somehow duplicated the browser and did a side by side comparison so she could copy over data. I'm going to check out this KDE option braxton is mentioning.
as for IM... alot of good ones there too, Pidgin, kopete, Amsn
they are taking to this empathy pretty well.
you on the standard gnome desktop now too right?
i personally love the new LXDE desktop ...so awesome
yeah Compiz has a set of a bunch of options for all those cool features
LOL i feel yeah..im family tech support too..i wish they would all switch to Linux so i could just ssh to their box's and fix stuff from my house
i love trying all different types of linux's
open suse that's a distro my father in law tells me is great I have got to try that one some day.
what is good about linux mint? I have never heard of that distro
its ubuntu based...very stable though
yah i love Linux Mint. It runs well.
